subject: Leadership
title: Conflict Resolution
description: A quick, practical guide to Conflict Resolution.

hook.text: Two teams blame each other for a missed deadline. The leader picks a side. The losing team checks out. Conflict deepens.

buildup.text: Conflict isn't the enemy. Unresolved conflict is. Healthy conflict drives better decisions when managed with skill.

discovery.text: Thomas-Kilmann model: five conflict stylesâ€”compete, avoid, accommodate, compromise, collaborate. Context matters.

twist.text: Most leaders default to compromise. But compromise often means both sides settle for less. Collaboration finds more.

climax.text: Resolve conflict by naming it, hearing both sides fully, finding shared interests, and co-creating a path forward.

punchline.text: Don't referee the fight. Remove the reason for it.

quiz.question: Why is compromise not always the best conflict resolution?
options: Both sides settle for less when collaboration could find more
